name: Colony Cove Beach Resort

reviews.title: Colony Cove Unit A303 - my other home
reviews.text: For 10 weeks in the spring of 2013 unit A303 was my other home. The purpose of my stay was a combination of business and pleasure, escaping the Danish winter while working for my Danish clients. For this type of stay there are obviously other requirements than for a usual vacation. To me it was of great importance that I could have a normal household, i.e. do my cooking, laundry, cleaning etc. This condo has all kitchen utensils required for cooking! It also has a washing machine and dryer, which was absolutely essential to me. I did the cleaning myself, and the necessary equipment for this, too, was available.

reviews.title: Condo "yes" reef, "no"
reviews.text: One thing I had some concerns about prior to my stay was the internet connection. Would I be able to connect? How would connectivity be? I did have some problems, but the local IT guy was very helpful in helping me get connected. However, the current WiFi signal is not very strong and capacity is limited. This means that the best spot to work from was actually on the patio where I would be facing the transmitter directly. There was no signal beyond the living room, i.e. I could not connect from the bedrooms. I heard that fibre optics cabling has been installed right at Colony Cove, it is just a matter of wiring the units. I sincerely hope this will be done prior to my next stay as connectivity is crucial to business people like me.
There are TV sets and DVD players in the living room and master bedroom, and a combined radio/CD player in the living room.
reviews.title: Favorite Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When it comes to shopping there are two grocery stores in walking distance. Food Town is my favourite and is reached in 10-15 minutes, 5 min by car. They have a large selection of quality food items, and the staff is helpful and friendly. The other one is Pueblo.
reviews.title: Unit A-102 Colony Cove

reviews.text: Shortly after Food Town you will find the Salud Bistro which is a great place to have dinner. The food is delicious and the staff very friendly. Closer to Colony Cove you will find the Breezez Restaurant.
reviews.title: Beautiful ocean views and landscaping, and very clean
My grade? An "F" standing for fun, friendly and fabulous!
reviews.text: My husband, mother-in-law and I just returned from a week in unit 102A, a two-bedroom, two bathroom condo, which the unit owner -- a lovely woman named Whitney -- calls "Caribbean Dreamin'."(Details at http://wearecaribbeandreamin.com/). Before we arrived we were told it was fully stocked, but we were skeptical, having heard that line before. Wow, were we surprised and delighted by what awaited us! A plethora of towels; linens; shampoo; soap; suntan lotion; beach items (chairs, coolers); dishes and the all-important RUM! To find 12 full bottles of rum on the top of the fridge all for our enjoyment with the only stipulation being, "If you finish a bottle, please buy another to replace it" just knocked our socks off. We are "really heavy" drinkers so we managed to get through about 1/3 of one bottle... LOL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Adding to the fully-stocked overall picture, there was even a full pint of ice cream in the freezer. Not sure if that was purchased for us or left by the previous renters, but it was a wonderful treat.
reviews.title: Little piece of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The unit itself was also very comfortable and well furnished. The lighting was a bit dim in the living room and bedrooms, but that's merely a matter of an additional lamp or a stronger bulb, so hardly "an issue." The water pressure was also a bit weak in the guest shower, but I'm inclined to say that's out of Whitney's control and, again, not a major issue, at least not for me.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay at Colony Cove In St. Croix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a TV and lots of books to read, but who needs any of that stuff when you can sit on the balcony and enjoy the evening air. One cautionary note: Bring PLENTY of bug spray. The "no-see-ums" will eat you alive if you're not slathered in bug repellent. Even that was available in the condo. Amazing....
reviews.title: Perfect vacation!

reviews.text: The grounds of the complex are also lovely. There's a charming little garden with herbs that you can pick and use in your cooking, which I did. Fun! That is, if you're inclined to get up off your lounge chair at the pool, where residents and guests congregate at every hour of the day. The vacationers and owners alike are a very friendly bunch and glad to offer a tip about dining out or snorkeling or whatever. Do be sure to strike up a conversation with them.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week this summer at this resort, right on the beach. The complex has been renovated and painted and seems to be in top shape. There is a nice pool, a lovely tropical garden and of course a beach. The staff was very helpful, especially Liz in the office. We loved walking on the beach and snorkeling around a manmade reef in the bay. The bay is protected by a coral reef so the waves are small and it is very easy to snorkel. We saw rays in the sand and lots of colorful fish. The location of the complex is very good... just 5 minutes to Christiasted. There were 2 grocery stores on the main street so we could easily cook in the condo. We had a wonderful dinner at Breezes which is just up the beach. We stayed in 102D which is right on the beach. It is a clean, well equiped condo and the view of the beach and water is spectacular. The condo looks like it has been completely renovated with new bathrooms, kitchen, furniture and applicances We loved having breakfast outside on the lanai, just a few feet from the waters edge. Although it is right on the beach it seems very quiet and private. Many days we had the beach to ourselves. A word to the wise, the only building that is oceanfront is the D building. The other buildings have a view of the garden and the pool but do not look directly out on the beach and water. We were very happy with the unit and Colony Cove for a value priced beach vacation on St. Croix. We will be doing it again and staying in the same unit.
reviews.title: Newly Renovated - Great Value

reviews.text: I've returned to Colony Cove year after year, and have now started to return to the same unit as well. A303 is a great unit to rent, it is fully air conditioned thru out, unlike a majority of the units at CC.
reviews.title: A303 Quiet and relaxing

reviews.text: It had an additional air conditioning unit in the Living Rm/Dining Rm/Kitchen area.
reviews.title: Quiet, relaxing family vacay

reviews.text: Make relaxing after a day in the sun with the humidity very bearable. Opening the sliding doors and letting the ocean breeze in is also an option; I like the variety of both, but enjoy the fact that I can just veg out with the air conditioning on without having to "retreat" to a bedroom to get cooled off like you would in most other units. Out of 60 units at CC I believe only 4 are completely air conditioned. Not sure how many of those 4 are occupied year round and if they are rentable for vacationers like myself.
reviews.title: Awsome Vacation

reviews.text: The owners of!A303 have continually upgraded/improved upon it year after year. Bedrooms have nice bedding on them, unit as whole has nice decor feels like home away from home as soon as you walk in the door.
reviews.title: Paradice in nut shell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dear Antilles Resort Management,
reviews.title: This is the letter we sent to the condo managment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I and my husband are on our last night of our five day vacation at Colony Cove on San Croix.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay Colony Cove 202D

reviews.text: We used the travel site at American Express, as we have satisfactorily for many years, to book our trip. We am going to give you the opportunity to address our experience, as well as our concerns before we contact them.
reviews.title: Perfect location, Good unit, Excellent pool area, Great snorkeling!

reviews.text: Our first evening here was fine, we were meant by Vickie, the security guard and she was kind and helpful. Our next day was uneventful, but the following day was filled with so much construction noise, that was so loud and non-stop we needed to be moved. I believe when condos are being renovated management should let people know, we would like to be the ones to decide if we want to be exposed to that kind of chaos on our vacation.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise On the Beach
fraud alert
reviews.text: The office was helpful and did move us. HOWEVER, the condo we were moved to, 305 A, though it appeared at first glance to be fine was filthy. The lounge chairs on the porch were covered in mud, with cushions just thrown on top of them. There was black hair in every corner of every room, and most of all behind the bathroom doors. The place is filled with small tan colored ants or terminates. When I told the office personnel about the hair everywhere and about the muddy patio furniture, she seemed very concerned. A ineffective cleaning job followed, still hair everywhere. The office never followed up to see if the problems were taken care of. Since them we have found that two lamps don't work, a third has no light bulb, the hair dryer is broken as well as the iron. Maintenance men came into the condo, this afternoon, while we were here, never knocking, worked on an air conditioner, yelling back and forth to each other, left without a word, and left our door ajar. We also found the washing machine filled with wet, mildewed maintenance coveralls.

description: Modern Condominium Resort situated beachfront, 2 miles from Christiansted & 29 from airport.
